definition: lit. all the stars cup themselves around the moon (idiom, from Analects); fig. to view sb as core figure/to group around a revered leader/to revolve around sb

sentences.english: Then there came a foreigner, soon he was surrounded by a lot of people.
sentences.chinese: 然后来了个老外，很快被一群人众星捧月着。

sentences.english: Up to 3,000 orbited around the Son of Heaven like satellites.
sentences.chinese: 三千多名宦官如众星捧月般围绕着天子的周遭。

definition: see 眾星捧月|众星捧月[zhong4 xing1 peng3 yue4]

a crane in a flock of chicken (idiom); way above the common/manifestly superior
precious horses and magnificent carriage (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
